trans-unit.source: SQL Database Design for Business Continuity
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Design for Business Continuity

trans-unit.source: Guidance for choosing In this section, guidance will be provided for how to choose which BCDR features should be used and when. This will include descriptions of what you automatically get by using SQL DB.
trans-unit.target: Guidance for choosing In this section, guidance will be provided for how to choose which BCDR features should be used and when. This will include descriptions of what you automatically get by using SQL DB.

trans-unit.source: Design for business continuity
trans-unit.target: Design for business continuity

trans-unit.source: Designing your application for business continuity requires you to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Designing your application for business continuity requires you to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Which business continuity feature is appropriate for protecting my application from outages?
trans-unit.target: Which business continuity feature is appropriate for protecting my application from outages?

trans-unit.source: What level of redundancy and replication topology do I use?
trans-unit.target: What level of redundancy and replication topology do I use?

trans-unit.source: When to use Geo-Restore
trans-unit.target: When to use Geo-Restore

trans-unit.source: SQL Database provides a built-in basic protection of every database by default.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database provides a built-in basic protection of every database by default.

trans-unit.source: It is done by storing the database backups in the geo-redundant Azure storage (GRS).
trans-unit.target: It is done by storing the database backups in the geo-redundant Azure storage (GRS).

trans-unit.source: If you choose this method, no special configuration or additional resource allocation is necessary.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this method, no special configuration or additional resource allocation is necessary.

trans-unit.source: With these backups, you can recover your database in any region using the Geo-Restore command.
trans-unit.target: With these backups, you can recover your database in any region using the Geo-Restore command.

trans-unit.source: Use <link><linkText>Recover from an outage</linkText><title></title></link> section for the details of using geo-restore to recover your application.
trans-unit.target: Use <link><linkText>Recover from an outage</linkText><title></title></link> section for the details of using geo-restore to recover your application.

trans-unit.source: You should use the built-in protection if your application meets the following criteria:
trans-unit.target: You should use the built-in protection if your application meets the following criteria:

trans-unit.source: It is not considered mission critical.
trans-unit.target: It is not considered mission critical.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't have a binding SLA therefore the downtime of 24 hours or longer will not result in financial liability.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't have a binding SLA therefore the downtime of 24 hours or longer will not result in financial liability.

trans-unit.source: The rate of data change is low (e.g. transactions per hour).
trans-unit.target: The rate of data change is low (e.g. transactions per hour).

trans-unit.source: The RPO of 1 hour will not result in a massive data loss.
trans-unit.target: The RPO of 1 hour will not result in a massive data loss.

trans-unit.source: The application is cost sensitive and cannot justify the additional cost of Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: The application is cost sensitive and cannot justify the additional cost of Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore does not pre-allocate the compute capacity in any particular region to restore active databases from the backup during the outage.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore does not pre-allocate the compute capacity in any particular region to restore active databases from the backup during the outage.

trans-unit.source: The service will manage the workload associated with the geo-restore requests in a manner that minimizes the impact on the existing databases in that region and their capacity demands will have priority.
trans-unit.target: The service will manage the workload associated with the geo-restore requests in a manner that minimizes the impact on the existing databases in that region and their capacity demands will have priority.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the recovery time of your database will depend on how many other databases will be recovering in the same region at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the recovery time of your database will depend on how many other databases will be recovering in the same region at the same time.

trans-unit.source: When to use Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: When to use Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Geo-Replication creates a replica database (secondary) in a different region from your primary.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Replication creates a replica database (secondary) in a different region from your primary.

trans-unit.source: It guarantees that your database will have the necessary data and compute resources to support the application's workload after the recovery.
trans-unit.target: It guarantees that your database will have the necessary data and compute resources to support the application's workload after the recovery.

trans-unit.source: Refer to <link><linkText>Recover from an outage</linkText><title></title></link> section for using failover to recover your application.
trans-unit.target: Refer to <link><linkText>Recover from an outage</linkText><title></title></link> section for using failover to recover your application.

trans-unit.source: You should use the Geo-Replication if your application meets the following criteria:
trans-unit.target: You should use the Geo-Replication if your application meets the following criteria:

trans-unit.source: It is mission critical.
trans-unit.target: It is mission critical.

trans-unit.source: It has a binding SLA with aggressive RPO and RTO.
trans-unit.target: It has a binding SLA with aggressive RPO and RTO.

trans-unit.source: Loss of data and availability will result in financial liability.
trans-unit.target: Loss of data and availability will result in financial liability.

trans-unit.source: The rate of data change is high (e.g. transactions per minute or seconds).
trans-unit.target: The rate of data change is high (e.g. transactions per minute or seconds).

trans-unit.source: The RPO of 1 hr associated with the default protection will likely result in unacceptable data loss.
trans-unit.target: The RPO of 1 hr associated with the default protection will likely result in unacceptable data loss.

trans-unit.source: The cost associated with using Geo-Replication is significantly lower than the potential financial liability and associated loss of business.
trans-unit.target: The cost associated with using Geo-Replication is significantly lower than the potential financial liability and associated loss of business.

trans-unit.source: If your application uses Basic tier database(s) Geo-Repliation is not supported
trans-unit.target: If your application uses Basic tier database(s) Geo-Repliation is not supported

trans-unit.source: When to choose Standard vs. Active Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: When to choose Standard vs. Active Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Standard tier databases do not have the option of using Active Geo-Replication so if your application uses standard databases and meets the above criteria it should enable Standard Geo-Replication.
trans-unit.target: Standard tier databases do not have the option of using Active Geo-Replication so if your application uses standard databases and meets the above criteria it should enable Standard Geo-Replication.

trans-unit.source: Premium databases on the other hand can choose either option.
trans-unit.target: Premium databases on the other hand can choose either option.

trans-unit.source: Standard Geo-Replication has been designed as a simpler and less expensive disaster recovery solution, particularly suited to applications that use it only to protect from unplanned events such as outages.
trans-unit.target: Standard Geo-Replication has been designed as a simpler and less expensive disaster recovery solution, particularly suited to applications that use it only to protect from unplanned events such as outages.

trans-unit.source: With Standard Geo-Replication you can only use the DR paired region for the recovery and do have the ability to create more than one secondary.
trans-unit.target: With Standard Geo-Replication you can only use the DR paired region for the recovery and do have the ability to create more than one secondary.

trans-unit.source: This latter feature is critical for the application upgrade scenario.
trans-unit.target: This latter feature is critical for the application upgrade scenario.

trans-unit.source: So if this scenario is critical for your application you should enable Active Geo-Replication instead.
trans-unit.target: So if this scenario is critical for your application you should enable Active Geo-Replication instead.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to <link><linkText>Upgrade application without downtime</linkText><title></title></link> for additional details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to <link><linkText>Upgrade application without downtime</linkText><title></title></link> for additional details.

trans-unit.source: Active Geo-Replication also supports read-only access to the secondary database thus providing additional capacity for the read-only workloads.
trans-unit.target: Active Geo-Replication also supports read-only access to the secondary database thus providing additional capacity for the read-only workloads.

trans-unit.source: How to enable Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: How to enable Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: You can enable Geo-Replicatiom using Azure Portal or by calling REST API or PowerShell command.
trans-unit.target: You can enable Geo-Replicatiom using Azure Portal or by calling REST API or PowerShell command.

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: On the left side of the screen select BROWSE and then select SQL Databases
trans-unit.target: On the left side of the screen select BROWSE and then select SQL Databases

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your database blade, select the Geo Replication map and click Configure Geo-Replication.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your database blade, select the Geo Replication map and click Configure Geo-Replication.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to Geo-Replication blade.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to Geo-Replication blade.

trans-unit.source: Select the target region.
trans-unit.target: Select the target region.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Create Secondary blade.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Create Secondary blade.

trans-unit.source: Select an existing server in the target region or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing server in the target region or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Select the secondary type (Readable or Non-readable)
trans-unit.target: Select the secondary type (Readable or Non-readable)

trans-unit.source: Click Create to complete the configuration
trans-unit.target: Click Create to complete the configuration

trans-unit.source: The DR paired region on the Geo-Replication blade will be marked as recommended.
trans-unit.target: The DR paired region on the Geo-Replication blade will be marked as recommended.

trans-unit.source: If you use a Premium tier database you can choose a different region.
trans-unit.target: If you use a Premium tier database you can choose a different region.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a Standard database you cannot change it.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a Standard database you cannot change it.

trans-unit.source: The Premium database will have a choice of the secondary type (Readable or Non-readable).
trans-unit.target: The Premium database will have a choice of the secondary type (Readable or Non-readable).

trans-unit.source: Standard database can only select a Non-readable secondary.
trans-unit.target: Standard database can only select a Non-readable secondary.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title></link> PowerShell cmdlet to automate Geo-Replication configuration.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title></link> PowerShell cmdlet to automate Geo-Replication configuration.

trans-unit.source: To create Geo-Replication with a non-readable secondary for a Premium or Standard database:
trans-unit.target: To create Geo-Replication with a non-readable secondary for a Premium or Standard database:

trans-unit.source: To create Geo-Replication with a readable secondary for a Premium database:
trans-unit.target: To create Geo-Replication with a readable secondary for a Premium database:

trans-unit.source: This command is asynchronous.
trans-unit.target: This command is asynchronous.

trans-unit.source: After it returns use the <link><linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to check the status of this operation.
trans-unit.target: After it returns use the <link><linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to check the status of this operation.

trans-unit.source: The ReplicationState field of the returned object will have the value CATCH_UP when the operation is completed.
trans-unit.target: The ReplicationState field of the returned object will have the value CATCH_UP when the operation is completed.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Use <link><linkText>Start Database Copy</linkText><title></title></link> API to programmatically create a Geo-Replication configuration.
trans-unit.target: Use <link><linkText>Start Database Copy</linkText><title></title></link> API to programmatically create a Geo-Replication configuration.

trans-unit.source: This API is asynchronous.
trans-unit.target: This API is asynchronous.

trans-unit.source: After it returns use the <link><linkText>Get Database Copy</linkText><title></title></link> API check the status of this operation.
trans-unit.target: After it returns use the <link><linkText>Get Database Copy</linkText><title></title></link> API check the status of this operation.

trans-unit.source: The ReplicationState field of the response body will have the value CATCH_UP when the operation is completed.
trans-unit.target: The ReplicationState field of the response body will have the value CATCH_UP when the operation is completed.

trans-unit.source: How to choose the failover configuration
trans-unit.target: How to choose the failover configuration

trans-unit.source: When designing your application for business continuity you should consider several configuration options.
trans-unit.target: When designing your application for business continuity you should consider several configuration options.

trans-unit.source: The choice will depend on the application deployment topology and what parts of your applications are most vulnerable to an outage.
trans-unit.target: The choice will depend on the application deployment topology and what parts of your applications are most vulnerable to an outage.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to <link><linkText>Designing Cloud Solutions for Disaster Recovery Using Active Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title></link> for guidance.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to <link><linkText>Designing Cloud Solutions for Disaster Recovery Using Active Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title></link> for guidance.
